title: 4-year-old shot at apartment complex
content:
MEMPHIS, TN (WMC) -
A 4-year-old went to the hospital Thursday night after being shot at an apartment complex.
The shooting happened before 9:30 p.m. at Longview Heights Apartments on Jacklyn Avenue.
The security guard working at the apartment complex said he heard gunshots and immediately called 911.
A neighbor told police two people were shooting at each other and the child was caught in the crossfire, but a police investigation determined this report to be inaccurate.
Memphis Police Department said the shooting really began when the child's family got locked out of their home. In an effort to help them out, a family friend started climbing through a window. That's when a gun fell out of his pocket and went off.
A bullet accidentally fired from the gun hit the 4-year-old.
The child was taken to Le Bonheur Children's Hospital in non-critical condition.
